summary: Not really a request; More or less something I wrote for my wife @thatweirdrandomone w/ her student OC. And since a chunk of...
caption:
Not really a request; More or less something I wrote for my wife @thatweirdrandomone w/ her student OC. And since a chunk of people like Todoroki I figured I’d post it here ^_^

Shoto x Fem!OC (Part One?)

Words: 2300~

Warning: None

‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵ ‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵ 

Friday afternoon.

Not a soul really wanted to stay after school on a Friday. Hero or not keeping kids past the time the UA bell rang was a struggle even for those pro heros. Andi wasn’t in such a hurry to get home. Not that she hated it. There was just something lonely about a weekend spent alone cramming for class in a city still so new and unfamiliar. It was what the young hero wanted moving all the way to the Japan branch when a slot within the hero academy opened up. Passing the entrance exams in the states was one thing. Where she wanted to train was UA.

Be it true there was something more she wished she could show for such sacrifices aside from being a second year in room 1 B. Striving to be the top was hard with a mind quirk. The teachers as well as the principle had warned the young female of that. Nearly advising her and the family against it since there was no guarantee Andi would be able to keep up with strength quirks and 1 A students. Regardless she tried. Even if it meant lonely weekends and little down time. She took it with great pride. Though staying after school on a Friday wasn’t everyone’s cup of tea. It simply allowed her a notion of doing good and keeping busy to offer more cleaning an extracurricular help.

Today was no exception. The UA sports festival had happened a little over a week ago but many of the course students were still feeling the lag. Andi had made it to round three. One on one battles. But after one round there was no way her quirk helped in a test of physical aptitude. Which this year seemed to be the only thing the top three winners had to trope competition. Andi wasn’t hurt though. As a second year she still had one more UA festive to shine in. And besides that she was a mind quirk who’d made it one bracket father than another student with a mind quirk. So to her it was still an honorable win to show off those skills. 

Now though it was about physical power. So she volunteered to move some boxes of texts and other articles from business class to general studies. Heavy lifting wasn’t going to be alleviated by her quirk so Andi found this the best chance to start on more strength training. While also keeping her mind from wandering.

Down with the last grueling box of old dusty year one books schlepped off at business studies. She found it perfect timing as it was nearly six o'clock. Which meant she could go back to the apartment just to cook, eat, shove in some studying and be ready to go to bed without much down time. Shouldering the school bag and locking up 1 B like promised. Andi focus down on her phone switching through annoying voicemails from parents and the annoying notifications for apps no one gave a rats ass about. By this time all classrooms should be shut up and empty for the night. Not the case when she passed room 1 A.

Certainly not expecting the hero course to even have any students still here and not off enjoying the weekend. She jump a little surprised seeing one kid stuck staring at something on his desk. A step and a half back so the door frame hid her. It didn’t seem they noticed or heard the passwerby.

’That’s odd….’ Andi squinted her eyes trying to place the white and red haired lad, she knew she’d seen him somewhere, ’….oh! The boy who placed second! Toro- No- Tadaork- Not that- Todoroki! The fire and ice guy!’

Almost ashamed she hadn’t even paid enough attention to recall the winners names. Andi was momentarily caught off guard seeing something drip off his face. Recalling his affinity for that overly power ice attacks she reckoned it must be byproduct of his quirk. Ice wasn’t meant to be inside in warm climate controlled air. How hard it must have been being ice AND fire. A constant battle of hoping one don’t fire up or drench their clothes. Sure she’s just passing by, Andi made to walk on her way when the 1 A student raises his arm and wipes away at his face.

She blinks mid stare. That wasn’t melting ice. He was crying.

Silently sure but looking harder reveals how upsettingly right she is. Not many but a dotting trail of tears on his paper. Though the B class student couldn’t see what the paper was but knew the dread of crying over a test. She’d had her fair share of waterworks herself over tests. 

Engulfed in leaning into the door frame trying to guess what was wrong. While also being heart stricken that even a second place winner was crying. Andi wasn’t mindful of her quirk as her thoughts wander.

Unlike those with malice mind quirks. Such as brainwashing or putting people to sleep. Hers was almost always seen as a novelty. Thought mostly done on purpose, the girls mind projected like a blanket. Not terribly far but enough people within combat range reported feeling it. To a sensation of calmness or contentedness. Andi had found out if battling hard enough that calming effect could be changed to an addling effect. Which posed better use during a fight. Sadly though she hadn’t learned how to switch between a comforting projection or a confusion one.

This was one of those times she wasn’t aware she was doing it at all. Forlorn just to see someone distressed her thoughts were a ramble but they still sought out like tendrils for the nearest life form. Not evening noticing she was doing anything until Andi saw Todoroki lean up from his paper and touch his cheeks. Where he’d felt stray tears were now suddenly gone. That overwhelming loathsome string of thoughts in his mind nearly all gone. Not like he’d forgotten what had upset him. But that they just seemed so, insignificant now. Replaced with a gentle calmness in regards to nothing the 1 A student ever felt.

Todoroki looked from his desk to the open classroom door. She was busted. Suddenly realizing that bad habit of letting her mind wander happened all too much. Clasping hands over her mouth like words actually had anything to do with it. Andi jerked back with a thudding heart hoping he hadn’t seen her.

“….A mind quirk,” Todoroki’s low voice filled the space between, “That’s not something we see a lot here at UA is it?” He cast his heterochromia eyes over to the door where he knew the intruder was, “And for one so kind willed, it’s a wonder you want to be a hero.”

Busted.

Knowing there was no way to play off that he had the wrong person now. Andi stepped into the doorway. Fist clenching her bag straps afraid what he might do if he interrupted her as spying, “I…I’m sorry I wasn’t trying to watch you or anything. Honestly, I just done moving things for class 1 B and didn’t expect….well didn’t expect to see anyone else here this late either.” Attempting to play it off as cool she laughed light heartedly rubbing the back of her head, “Especially from class 1 A! I thought you guys all dashed out of here the moment the bell rang!”

He looked back down at the paper in front of him. What was a pitiful excuse for a joke failed and Andi felt her dread setting in. He probably really did think she was snooping around after hours now.

“Thank you,” His words surprised her even though he didn’t look up at the girl. They were certainly meant towards her.

“Huh?” Andi stopped playing the cool act with his unexpected words, “I uh no I didn’t-”

“I was quite upset about this test score,” Todoroki turned his face away from the paper and to the student in the doorway, “With as much prep as I’d done it had blindsided me that Mr. Aizawa marked as many wrong as he did.”

“Uh I’m sorry about your test scores…” she shifted a little uncomfortable not following anymore. At this point being caught red handed embarrassed the timidly straightlaced student enough. And didn’t give her a chance to recall her quirk. Without thinking she’d been projecting her feelings right out to the sullen school mate without her own knowledge.

Todoroki rose from his seat. Placing the no longer important test paper in his pack before stepping up to her. Since she was a second year student she was technically older. But Andi wouldn’t stop cursing high school for all the boys getting their growth spurts now. And she’d topping out at your max height in middle school. A half step back when he came up to her so silently only made Andi fumble in a panic. Just as quick as he was in the festival battles. The young fire and ice hero grabbed her wrist and helped her step back onto two solid feet.

“Oh- Uh thanks-” she smiled sheepishly rubbing the back of her head, “Guess that makes us even now.”

Todoroki looked this new individual up and down. His guess right when he recognized her as the second year student who’d made it to round two in the one on one battles. But had been beat by one of his own classmates due to speed and the inability to pitch a mind quirk to a hero who only needed mere seconds to push one out of the ring. She had done well and put up a fight. For that other students including the second place one had noticed.

“Andi Meyier right? That quirk,” Todoroki studied her, “It calms people?”

Not expecting to have him ask about it. She nodded seeing he got half of it right, “Yes, for the most part. But sadly not like hypnosis.That would be more useful in a fight. I’ve been able to project a few other stronger emotions but not with an regularity to make in part of my arsenal.”

“So you could make someone feel sad, or angry, happy or jealous?” Todoroki through out options trying to pin point her exactly.

For those guesses she had to shake her head no, “Not so much. I can confuse mostly, leaving someone stunned or unable to react to a situation. But like I said, the calming affect is all I’ve really got.” Andi looked down at her hand. Thinking this school would bring out more in her. Two years had gone by and she was really starting to wonder if this was a hero quirk at all. So many other helpful things could be done with it. But here she was being selfish and wanting to become a hero. It gnawed at her day in and day out if this was the right choice.

“Interesting,” Todoroki’s voice snapped her from the latent trail of thoughts in her mind. Andi looked from her hand up to him. Heat creeping on her cheeks as he was vividly and clearly studying her. Nearly about to break away and end this before she embarrassed herself anymore. He had something surprising to add, “Would you like to study together?”

Floored even that a 1 A student wanted to study with someone who hardly past as a support hero on a good day. She nearly gagged on the flood of words that fight to make it out of her mouth at the same time. No more abashed by that nonverbal response Todoroki still enjoyed the effects of the female’s calming ability and explained further, “When I studied for this test I was riled up. My thoughts got the best of me and this grading period suffered from it.If you can help me retain a calm mindset to study, I’d be more than happy to return the favor and help you physically train.” Andi’s face full on heated up. No way now to deny her own prattling lucid thoughts before really did give her away. The embarrassment seemed to only be one sided thought which helped. Todoroki looked at her unphased, “It would be even, that way.”

Given an opportunity to train with those going pro was undeniable one of the best chances she had at getting to where she wanted. PE class just couldn’t cut it and Andi didn’t know enough about physical combat to set up a workout regimen that would do her the max good. And here she was being offered help by a literal runner up to the UA festival. Maybe her face gave it away. Or perhaps still her mind was wandered too much around this fellow for her own good.

But as placid as his expression stayed. The corner of Todoroki’s lip curled up and he placed a hand on her shoulder, “Good. Meet me outside the cram building tomorrow at eight o'clock. We can begin then.”

“Tomorrow?? Eight o'clock??” Andi nearly choked not realizing he wanted to start right away on this barter for quirk deals.

Todoroki stopped only a few steps pasted her and cocked his head back to the older student, “We both clearly don’t have any plans with friends or family. That much I could gather from your thoughts.”

Fire engine red cheeks, Andi half covered her face like she could shove her quirk back in her brain and make it stop embarrassing herself, “Y-Yes! Tomorrow at eight! I’ll be there.”

Again unable to help the curl of a faint smile on his lips Todoroki at least turned back away so he wouldn’t give himself away, “Good. I look forward to seeing what we can make of this.”

reblog.comment:

Andi focus down on her phone switching through annoying voicemails from parents and the annoying notifications for apps no one gave a rats ass about. By this time all classrooms should be shut up and empty for the night. Not the case when she passed room 1 A.

Certainly not expecting the hero course to even have any students still here and not off enjoying the weekend. She jump a little surprised seeing one kid stuck staring at something on his desk. A step and a half back so the door frame hid her. It didn’t seem they noticed or heard the passwerby.

’That’s odd….’ Andi squinted her eyes trying to place the white and red haired lad, she knew she’d seen him somewhere, ’….oh! The boy who placed second! Toro- No- Tadaork- Not that- Todoroki! The fire and ice guy!’

Almost ashamed she hadn’t even paid enough attention to recall the winners names. Andi was momentarily caught off guard seeing something drip off his face. Recalling his affinity for that overly power ice attacks she reckoned it must be byproduct of his quirk. Ice wasn’t meant to be inside in warm climate controlled air. How hard it must have been being ice AND fire. A constant battle of hoping one don’t fire up or drench their clothes. Sure she’s just passing by, Andi made to walk on her way when the 1 A student raises his arm and wipes away at his face.

She blinks mid stare. That wasn’t melting ice. He was crying.

Silently sure but looking harder reveals how upsettingly right she is. Not many but a dotting trail of tears on his paper. Though the B class student couldn’t see what the paper was but knew the dread of crying over a test. She’d had her fair share of waterworks herself over tests. 

Engulfed in leaning into the door frame trying to guess what was wrong. While also being heart stricken that even a second place winner was crying. Andi wasn’t mindful of her quirk as her thoughts wander.

Unlike those with malice mind quirks. Such as brainwashing or putting people to sleep. Hers was almost always seen as a novelty. Thought mostly done on purpose, the girls mind projected like a blanket. Not terribly far but enough people within combat range reported feeling it. To a sensation of calmness or contentedness. Andi had found out if battling hard enough that calming effect could be changed to an addling effect. Which posed better use during a fight. Sadly though she hadn’t learned how to switch between a comforting projection or a confusion one.

This was one of those times she wasn’t aware she was doing it at all. Forlorn just to see someone distressed her thoughts were a ramble but they still sought out like tendrils for the nearest life form. Not evening noticing she was doing anything until Andi saw Todoroki lean up from his paper and touch his cheeks. Where he’d felt stray tears were now suddenly gone. That overwhelming loathsome string of thoughts in his mind nearly all gone. Not like he’d forgotten what had upset him. But that they just seemed so, insignificant now. Replaced with a gentle calmness in regards to nothing the 1 A student ever felt.

Todoroki looked from his desk to the open classroom door. She was busted. Suddenly realizing that bad habit of letting her mind wander happened all too much. Clasping hands over her mouth like words actually had anything to do with it. Andi jerked back with a thudding heart hoping he hadn’t seen her.

“….A mind quirk,” Todoroki’s low voice filled the space between, “That’s not something we see a lot here at UA is it?” He cast his heterochromia eyes over to the door where he knew the intruder was, “And for one so kind willed, it’s a wonder you want to be a hero.”

Busted.

Knowing there was no way to play off that he had the wrong person now. Andi stepped into the doorway. Fist clenching her bag straps afraid what he might do if he interrupted her as spying, “I…I’m sorry I wasn’t trying to watch you or anything. Honestly, I just done moving things for class 1 B and didn’t expect….well didn’t expect to see anyone else here this late either.” Attempting to play it off as cool she laughed light heartedly rubbing the back of her head, “Especially from class 1 A! I thought you guys all dashed out of here the moment the bell rang!”

He looked back down at the paper in front of him. What was a pitiful excuse for a joke failed and Andi felt her dread setting in. He probably really did think she was snooping around after hours now.

“Thank you,” His words surprised her even though he didn’t look up at the girl. They were certainly meant towards her.

“Huh?” Andi stopped playing the cool act with his unexpected words, “I uh no I didn’t-”

“I was quite upset about this test score,” Todoroki turned his face away from the paper and to the student in the doorway, “With as much prep as I’d done it had blindsided me that Mr. Aizawa marked as many wrong as he did.”

“Uh I’m sorry about your test scores…” she shifted a little uncomfortable not following anymore. At this point being caught red handed embarrassed the timidly straightlaced student enough. And didn’t give her a chance to recall her quirk. Without thinking she’d been projecting her feelings right out to the sullen school mate without her own knowledge.

Todoroki rose from his seat. Placing the no longer important test paper in his pack before stepping up to her. Since she was a second year student she was technically older. But Andi wouldn’t stop cursing high school for all the boys getting their growth spurts now. And she’d topping out at your max height in middle school. A half step back when he came up to her so silently only made Andi fumble in a panic. Just as quick as he was in the festival battles. The young fire and ice hero grabbed her wrist and helped her step back onto two solid feet.

“Oh- Uh thanks-” she smiled sheepishly rubbing the back of her head, “Guess that makes us even now.”

Todoroki looked this new individual up and down. His guess right when he recognized her as the second year student who’d made it to round two in the one on one battles. But had been beat by one of his own classmates due to speed and the inability to pitch a mind quirk to a hero who only needed mere seconds to push one out of the ring. She had done well and put up a fight. For that other students including the second place one had noticed.

“Andi Meyier right? That quirk,” Todoroki studied her, “It calms people?”

Not expecting to have him ask about it. She nodded seeing he got half of it right, “Yes, for the most part. But sadly not like hypnosis.That would be more useful in a fight. I’ve been able to project a few other stronger emotions but not with an regularity to make in part of my arsenal.”

“So you could make someone feel sad, or angry, happy or jealous?” Todoroki through out options trying to pin point her exactly.

For those guesses she had to shake her head no, “Not so much. I can confuse mostly, leaving someone stunned or unable to react to a situation. But like I said, the calming affect is all I’ve really got.” Andi looked down at her hand. Thinking this school would bring out more in her. Two years had gone by and she was really starting to wonder if this was a hero quirk at all. So many other helpful things could be done with it. But here she was being selfish and wanting to become a hero. It gnawed at her day in and day out if this was the right choice.

“Interesting,” Todoroki’s voice snapped her from the latent trail of thoughts in her mind. Andi looked from her hand up to him. Heat creeping on her cheeks as he was vividly and clearly studying her. Nearly about to break away and end this before she embarrassed herself anymore. He had something surprising to add, “Would you like to study together?”

Floored even that a 1 A student wanted to study with someone who hardly past as a support hero on a good day. She nearly gagged on the flood of words that fight to make it out of her mouth at the same time. No more abashed by that nonverbal response Todoroki still enjoyed the effects of the female’s calming ability and explained further, “When I studied for this test I was riled up. My thoughts got the best of me and this grading period suffered from it.If you can help me retain a calm mindset to study, I’d be more than happy to return the favor and help you physically train.” Andi’s face full on heated up. No way now to deny her own prattling lucid thoughts before really did give her away. The embarrassment seemed to only be one sided thought which helped. Todoroki looked at her unphased, “It would be even, that way.”

Given an opportunity to train with those going pro was undeniable one of the best chances she had at getting to where she wanted. PE class just couldn’t cut it and Andi didn’t know enough about physical combat to set up a workout regimen that would do her the max good. And here she was being offered help by a literal runner up to the UA festival. Maybe her face gave it away. Or perhaps still her mind was wandered too much around this fellow for her own good.

But as placid as his expression stayed. The corner of Todoroki’s lip curled up and he placed a hand on her shoulder, “Good. Meet me outside the cram building tomorrow at eight o'clock. We can begin then.”

“Tomorrow?? Eight o'clock??” Andi nearly choked not realizing he wanted to start right away on this barter for quirk deals.

Todoroki stopped only a few steps pasted her and cocked his head back to the older student, “We both clearly don’t have any plans with friends or family. That much I could gather from your thoughts.”

Fire engine red cheeks, Andi half covered her face like she could shove her quirk back in her brain and make it stop embarrassing herself, “Y-Yes! Tomorrow at eight! I’ll be there.”

Again unable to help the curl of a faint smile on his lips Todoroki at least turned back away so he wouldn’t give himself away, “Good. I look forward to seeing what we can make of this.”
trail.content:
Not really a request; More or less something I wrote for my wife @thatweirdrandomone w/ her student OC. And since a chunk of people like Todoroki I figured I’d post it here ^_^

Shoto x Fem!OC (Part One?)

Words: 2300~

Warning: None

‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵ ‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵‿︵ 

Friday afternoon.

Not a soul really wanted to stay after school on a Friday. Hero or not keeping kids past the time the UA bell rang was a struggle even for those pro heros. Andi wasn’t in such a hurry to get home. Not that she hated it. There was just something lonely about a weekend spent alone cramming for class in a city still so new and unfamiliar. It was what the young hero wanted moving all the way to the Japan branch when a slot within the hero academy opened up. Passing the entrance exams in the states was one thing. Where she wanted to train was UA.

Be it true there was something more she wished she could show for such sacrifices aside from being a second year in room 1 B. Striving to be the top was hard with a mind quirk. The teachers as well as the principle had warned the young female of that. Nearly advising her and the family against it since there was no guarantee Andi would be able to keep up with strength quirks and 1 A students. Regardless she tried. Even if it meant lonely weekends and little down time. She took it with great pride. Though staying after school on a Friday wasn’t everyone’s cup of tea. It simply allowed her a notion of doing good and keeping busy to offer more cleaning an extracurricular help.

Today was no exception. The UA sports festival had happened a little over a week ago but many of the course students were still feeling the lag. Andi had made it to round three. One on one battles. But after one round there was no way her quirk helped in a test of physical aptitude. Which this year seemed to be the only thing the top three winners had to trope competition. Andi wasn’t hurt though. As a second year she still had one more UA festive to shine in. And besides that she was a mind quirk who’d made it one bracket father than another student with a mind quirk. So to her it was still an honorable win to show off those skills. 

Now though it was about physical power. So she volunteered to move some boxes of texts and other articles from business class to general studies. Heavy lifting wasn’t going to be alleviated by her quirk so Andi found this the best chance to start on more strength training. While also keeping her mind from wandering.

Down with the last grueling box of old dusty year one books schlepped off at business studies. She found it perfect timing as it was nearly six o'clock. Which meant she could go back to the apartment just to cook, eat, shove in some studying and be ready to go to bed without much down time. Shouldering the school bag and locking up 1 B like promised. Andi focus down on her phone switching through annoying voicemails from parents and the annoying notifications for apps no one gave a rats ass about. By this time all classrooms should be shut up and empty for the night. Not the case when she passed room 1 A.

Certainly not expecting the hero course to even have any students still here and not off enjoying the weekend. She jump a little surprised seeing one kid stuck staring at something on his desk. A step and a half back so the door frame hid her. It didn’t seem they noticed or heard the passwerby.

Engulfed in leaning into the door frame trying to guess what was wrong. While also being heart stricken that even a second place winner was crying. Andi wasn’t mindful of her quirk as her thoughts wander.

Unlike those with malice mind quirks. Such as brainwashing or putting people to sleep. Hers was almost always seen as a novelty. Thought mostly done on purpose, the girls mind projected like a blanket. Not terribly far but enough people within combat range reported feeling it. To a sensation of calmness or contentedness. Andi had found out if battling hard enough that calming effect could be changed to an addling effect. Which posed better use during a fight. Sadly though she hadn’t learned how to switch between a comforting projection or a confusion one.

This was one of those times she wasn’t aware she was doing it at all. Forlorn just to see someone distressed her thoughts were a ramble but they still sought out like tendrils for the nearest life form. Not evening noticing she was doing anything until Andi saw Todoroki lean up from his paper and touch his cheeks. Where he’d felt stray tears were now suddenly gone. Busted.

Honestly, I just done moving things for class 1 B and didn’t expect….well didn’t expect to see anyone else here this late either.” Attempting to play it off as cool she laughed light heartedly rubbing the back of her head, “Especially from class 1 A! I thought you guys all dashed out of here the moment the bell rang!”

He looked back down at the paper in front of him. What was a pitiful excuse for a joke failed and Andi felt her dread setting in. He probably really did think she was snooping around after hours now.

“Thank you,” His words surprised her even though he didn’t look up at the girl. They were certainly meant towards her.

“Huh?” Andi stopped playing the cool act with his unexpected words, “I uh no I didn’t-”

“I was quite upset about this test score,” Todoroki turned his face away from the paper and to the student in the doorway, “With as much prep as I’d done it had blindsided me that Mr. Aizawa marked as many wrong as he did.”

For those guesses she had to shake her head no, “Not so much. I can confuse mostly, leaving someone stunned or unable to react to a situation. Nearly about to break away and end this before she embarrassed herself anymore. He had something surprising to add, “Would you like to study together?”

She nearly gagged on the flood of words that fight to make it out of her mouth at the same time. No more abashed by that nonverbal response Todoroki still enjoyed the effects of the female’s calming ability and explained further, “When I studied for this test I was riled up. My thoughts got the best of me and this grading period suffered from it.If you can help me retain a calm mindset to study, I’d be more than happy to return the favor and help you physically train.” Andi’s face full on heated up. But as placid as his expression stayed. The corner of Todoroki’s lip curled up and he placed a hand on her shoulder, “Good. Meet me outside the cram building tomorrow at eight o'clock. We can begin then.”

summary: My ex broke up with me a week ago, because she liked someone else. My best friend has had a crush on her for a while now, when I...
body:
My ex broke up with me a week ago, because she liked someone else. My best friend has had a crush on her for a while now, when I told her that he liked her. I could see she changed, she no longer liked me anymore… My hearts been beaten, but it won’t be broken anymore.

I want them to be together, they seem happy together, though they aren’t dating just yet, I can tell that they will be either this week or the next.

This is not the only thing weighing me down, it’s also been life. Everyday I ask myself am I doing what I want in life, few days ago I found out what I wanted to do, hoping to forget the pain she caused me… I’ve never really hated anything in life up until now… I hate myself right now, I hate myself for being weak, I hate myself for being stupid and thinking I could be with her, a girl who I love, and still will until I forget entirely…

Right now I feel depressed, however I wanna keep smiling, All might’s master once said “The people who in this world who can smile are always the smile” I think about that everytime I’m sad, I try to rise up, but my mind is mixed up with love and doesn’t know how to right now.

blog.name: quirky-hero-imagines
blog.title: BNHA Imagines
blog.description:
Heyo! Another imagines and writing BNHA blog because there can never be enough💕 INBOX IS CLOSED [33]

Masterlist

FAQ Rules

summary: Hello I have a request😊 Kirishima realizing that he has a crush on tamaki's younger sister whos in the same grade as him. She is...
question: Hello I have a request😊 Kirishima realizing that he has a crush on tamaki's younger sister whos in the same grade as him. She is also shy but not as shy as tamaki more like she gets nervous around new people ya know. What would tamaki think of this? Headcanon or scenario your choice! Have a good day!
answer:
Thank you for sending a request ❤️

I decided to go with a scenario because it’s so cute!


Kirishima and you had been good friends for a little while now. You felt like his loud and excited personality filled in the spot that you were missing, like two puzzle pieces put together.

When you two had first met, Kirishima expected you to not want to talk to him, assuming that you took after your brother Tamaki. He thought that you looked so cute though so he took his chance.

He was pleasantly surprised that after the initial awkwardness your conversation had really taken off.


Right now, while walking you to your next class his heart beat faster every time he looked at your face. It took him some time to realize it, but he was crushing on you hard.

You wave him off with that amazing smile of yours and he walks off feeling dazed.


Kirishima makes his way through the hallway and happens to bump into Tamaki. “Ah Tamaki, how are you?” Kirishima asks but gets no response. “…Good. So can I talk to you?” He insists and Tamaki turns white at the thought but reluctantly nods his head.

-

Kirishima took Tamaki into one of the stairways, wanting some privacy.

“I’m just going to be honest with you. I really like y/n.” Kirishima says, fists clenched by his side.

Tamaki stares at him. “She does seem to like you as well….” Kirishima is shocked at getting a response but happy with it. “Would you be okay with me asking her out?” He asks. Tamaki looks down at the ground and shrugs. “It’s up to her.”

Kirishima nods his head. “Of course… Thank you!” He says and is about to run off when Tamaki grabs his shoulder. “It’s up to her… But I won’t be happy if you hurt her.” He says and Kirishima swallows loudly. “I won’t, that’s not what man do.”

Tamaki lets him go at this and Kirishima runs off.

-

Later that day after school Tamaki watches you from behind a wall while you talk to Kirishima.

He observes as Kirishima drops the question, seeing your face light up and hearing you say yes even from where he’s standing. You hug Kirishima, Tamaki taking note of how happy you both look. He smiles to himself before walking off, knowing that you are in good hands.

reblog.comment:
Thank you for sending a request ❤️

I decided to go with a scenario because it’s so cute!


Kirishima and you had been good friends for a little while now. You felt like his loud and excited personality filled in the spot that you were missing, like two puzzle pieces put together.

When you two had first met, Kirishima expected you to not want to talk to him, assuming that you took after your brother Tamaki. He thought that you looked so cute though so he took his chance.

He was pleasantly surprised that after the initial awkwardness your conversation had really taken off.


Right now, while walking you to your next class his heart beat faster every time he looked at your face. It took him some time to realize it, but he was crushing on you hard.

You wave him off with that amazing smile of yours and he walks off feeling dazed.


Kirishima makes his way through the hallway and happens to bump into Tamaki. “Ah Tamaki, how are you?” Kirishima asks but gets no response. “…Good. So can I talk to you?” He insists and Tamaki turns white at the thought but reluctantly nods his head.

-

Kirishima took Tamaki into one of the stairways, wanting some privacy.

“I’m just going to be honest with you. I really like y/n.” Kirishima says, fists clenched by his side.

Tamaki stares at him. “She does seem to like you as well….” Kirishima is shocked at getting a response but happy with it. “Would you be okay with me asking her out?” He asks. Tamaki looks down at the ground and shrugs. “It’s up to her.”

Kirishima nods his head. “Of course… Thank you!” He says and is about to run off when Tamaki grabs his shoulder. “It’s up to her… But I won’t be happy if you hurt her.” He says and Kirishima swallows loudly. “I won’t, that’s not what man do.”

Tamaki lets him go at this and Kirishima runs off.

-

Later that day after school Tamaki watches you from behind a wall while you talk to Kirishima.

He observes as Kirishima drops the question, seeing your face light up and hearing you say yes even from where he’s standing. You hug Kirishima, Tamaki taking note of how happy you both look. He smiles to himself before walking off, knowing that you are in good hands.

blog.description:
27 / m / Iowa

Hi there.  I'm Oatscar, otherwise known as Damascus.  I'm an aspiring fantasy author, feminist, and have Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD).  I'm here to pretty much post and reblog stuff I find interesting or funny.  My blog consists of about 35% social justice stuff, 15% weaboo trash, and 50% random funny shit I find.

Writing sideblog

Wish list

Drumpf prediction checklist

Author in the Holders Series

kittenboxxing and squid-ichorous are my BFFs

summary:
Not that I HATE One Punch Man, but I love My Hero Academia even more after watching both
OPM is a very cynical and borderline...
body:
Not that I HATE One Punch Man, but I love My Hero Academia even more after watching both

OPM is a very cynical and borderline depressing take on superheroes, but MHA’s take is so genuinely good-hearted. It’s earnest without being naive, uplifting while still being realistic about the social effects of superhero culture. For someone who is a cynical bastard all the time, this series is a breath of fresh air.

I genuinely like every single character in MHA (except Mineta) and am deeply invested in their character growth. Honestly this is fast becoming possibly my favorite anime of all time.
